numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that many young people seem more hopeful about the future.
2. I imagine that many people in developing countries are more hopeful than many people in first-world countries.
3. I notice that many adults in first-world countries do not seem hopeful.
4. I grew up in the age of technology.
6. In my experience, the media contains statements about climate change.
7. In my experience, the media contains political debates.
8. In my experience, the media contains statements that the Earth will split into millions of pieces.
9. I have never felt threatened by these statements.
10. I wonder why many young adults do not lose hope about our future.
11. I wonder why the media does not influence many young adults to lose hope about the future.
12. Australia is not on the graph.
13. I still relate to the data.
14. I think that some older people in my community are losing hope.
15. I think that some older people in my community are giving up.
16. Many older people will not be alive for all of our future.
17. Therefore, the future is less relevant for many older people.
